Question: Have you done anything exciting lately?
Answer: Recently I went on a walk around campus that I really enjoyed. It was exciting because I had never been on this part of campus and I got to see lots of new places. It was fun to see a new side of campus!

Question: Have you done anything exciting lately?
Answer: Yesterday I took a train to escape the city and go to a farm. I picked apples and raspberries from a field and bought pumpkins for halloween! It was a great day.
Curious Question: What do you like the most about Halloween?

Question: Have you done anything exciting lately?
Answer: Yes! I had some cultural events this weekend. They were a lot of fun, and I did a lot of dancing. I think I got enough cardio in for the year. They happen on a yearly basis so I already can't wait for next year.

Answer: I started school again after my internship and got the opportunity to reconnect with some of my old friends.

Question: Are you looking forward to anything soon?
Answer: I'm looking forward to Halloween! I'm excited to get dressed up, eat candy, and get together with my friends.

Question: Are you looking forward to anything soon?
Answer: I am planning on buying flight tickets to go back home for Christmas

Question: Are you looking forward to anything soon?
Answer: I am looking forward to reading week. I hope I get to do something fun, maybe a trip with friends? Or maybe I'll just be at home. Regardless, I am looking forward to it.

Question: Are you looking forward to anything soon?
Answer: I am looking forward to Reading Week - I think it will give me sometime to relax and catch-up on all the sleep I have been losing over this semester.

Question: What was the most fun you’ve had recently?
Answer: The most fun I've had recently was when I went out to have ramen with my friends. It was the best ramen I had eaten in a long time and afterwards we went shopping which was fun as well since we joked around a lot. It felt like I was back in high school with them.
Curious Question: What do you enjoy the most about your friends?

Question: What was the most fun you’ve had recently?
Answer: Recently I went on a day trip with my boyfriend and we had tons of fun, in general weekends are always fun because I don’t have to go to school and I can wake up late.
Curious Question: What's your favourite thing to do on the weekend?

Question: What was the most fun you’ve had recently?
Answer: For one of my courses, I had to do a mini field trip with my group. We had a lot of fun and somehow ended up being allowed to look through a party bus, because the driver saw us looking at the bus. It was very spontaneous and fun.
Curious Question: What was in the party bus that made it so fun?

Question: What was the most fun you’ve had recently?
Answer: For Thanksgiving, my roommates and I had a small "Friendsgiving" potluck dinner. It was really nice spending a relaxing evening having dinner and watching family movies with my closest friends.
Curious Question: What did you bring to the potluck?

Question: How have things been these past 2 weeks?
Answer: Things have been pretty great these past 2 weeks! I've been completing my work on time getting decent grades, and I've been exercising and eating healthier than the last time I went to university in person.
Curious Question: What has made you change and become healthier this year?

Question: How have things been these past 2 weeks?
Answer: Good I guess, I am always pretty busy and stressed with studying but so far I think I am achieving good results so I am quite satisfied with what I am doing.
Curious Question: Do you think there is something you could do to make studying less stressful?

Question: How have things been these past 2 weeks?
Answer: Really good for the most part. I am starting to worry about falling behind at schoolwork as midterms are approaching. I am going to try to not cram for any midterms last minute.
Curious Question: What about the past 2 weeks has been really good?

Question: How have things been these past 2 weeks?
Answer: Things have been very busy. Between school and job-hunting I barely get any real free time and most of the free time I do get is spent fulfilling social commitments - I don't ever really get me-time.
Curious Question: What would you do in your me-time?

Question: If you had one extra hour every day, how would you spend it?
Answer: If I had one extra hour every day, I would try to get some extra work done and out of the way so that I could have more freetime in the future.
Curious Question: What extra work would you work on?

Question: If you had one extra hour every day, how would you spend it?
Answer: I would love to spend the time in self care activities but knowing myself I will always have something more urgent to prioritize to complete work/study activities in advance.
Curious Question: Why is your self-care not urgent?

Question: If you had one extra hour every day, how would you spend it?
Answer: I would take time to do nothing. I read a book that emphasized how important it is for the brain to just be doing nothing other than just existing. I am almost always doing something, so I'd use this time to just sit and be.
Curious Question: Would you read another self-help book in this freetime?

Question: If you had one extra hour every day, how would you spend it?
Answer: I would use the extra time to do something just for myself like skincare, reading, journaling, coloring, puzzles etc.
Curious Question: What's your favourite thing to do for yourself?
